intro: Secamone szechuanensis, commonly known as the Sichuan secamone, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are often elliptical in shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
